title: I'm somewhat disappointed with Varus' new lore
body:
Him being a father and a husband to a murdered family, leading him to do the unthinkable and release the thing that lurked in the pit of Pallas was extremely important to him as a character.
it made him such a tragic champion who, seeking retribution, embraced a fate worse than death to avenge his fallen loved ones and destroy the Noxians responsible for the slaughter of his kin.

His new lore, kinda falls short.
I like the Darkin part, but The human Varus is so much more interesting than a sentient demon weapon.

Just my two cents on the topic.

Thank you for replying about this, but I really don't know how any more lore can fix this.  I like Varus for being the flawed and tragic human he was.  A man that chose duty over family and regretted it so much that it broke him.  A man that sold his soul for revenge, having nothing else to live for.  A man that is racing the clock to try and get as much revenge as he can before he is snuffed out.  A man that misses his family above all else.  

But we don't have that.  He doesn't even have his name anymore.  You literally took his name and gave it away.  I don't care about Varus the Darkin, he sounds no different from Rhaast and Aatrox.  The humans he's made of are literally a footnote, they don't matter.  

Even in the most drastic of redesigns/updates/lore rewrites, the champion has always kept some spirit of who they were or at least their name.  He was a grieving parent (something that is rare in League).  But from this there is not a single trace of original Varus left.  And I don't really see how any add on's to this version of him will improve what is being written over.

Hey all - I'm with the team behind this update to Varus, and this was a very accidental early release (PBE, d'oh). Totally get how jarring this is, and I promise there's major context coming. - as in, significantly more than just this bio.

We don't want to rush the actual release (our plan was to put the whole narrative out on 11/30, and the final preparations for that are happening now), so if it's cool with all of you I'd rather field some questions here that I can answer now, and you can get the full story for Varus when it launches.

EDIT: gonna call it on the questions for now, and disappearing for a few days with the family for Thanksgiving. Thanks for all the comments, and we'll be back soon

I'm glad you understand how much whiplash people are getting from this. Understandably, I feel like people are concerned about the change to his core character. It's not really the inclusion of a tragic backstory that concerns me, it's a departure from Varus himself. Two random Ionian hunters is not the Varus people love. He could so easily be fit into the Darkin lore by simply changing the nature of Pallas itself. I feel like what's concerning everyone is an unnecessary and what _feels_ like careless dissection of the concept of Varus, much akin to what happened to Diana and Leona, which essentially drained them of the traits that made them interesting, compelling and so importantly _relatable_ characters.

Alrighty, this new lore direction on Varus.

To put it simply, I don't like this direction. Malicious Metal has already highlighted the points that I have considered important to who Varus ***was***.  I'd like to offer my own thoughts on those points. While it's been guessed for a long while that Varus' bow was hinted to be a Darkin weapon, the concept of Varus the Human struggling against his fate before he ran out of time is what made him an engaging character. 

To sweep the Human off, throwing away a perfect tragedy to make room to just shove in the 'Darkin' quota feels cheap and wrong. Varus had focus. Emotion. An unstoppable drive to quench his vengeance before his being was burned away by the power of Darkin Bow. He had an amazing engagement as a character and hung on the precipice of one of the best story-driven characters in League. 

The new 'Darkin' Varus has none of those. 'Darkin' Varus is a sadist who got mad over his imprisonment.  

The direction as it is right now is poorly thought out. While these bios do represent an idea to see where the narrative team can go with updating champion lore, this, in my opinion is not the way to go about it. It completely destroys a character who had everything going for them and replaces them with a cheap, uninteractive knock off.

While talking to Ralanr he made a fantastic observations on the thematic of the Darkin we see.

Aatrox is the end result of a Darkin completely taking over it's host.
Kayn & Rhaast represent the final struggle between Darkin / host
Varus represented the beginning of change when bound with the host.

Had the direction been more along the lines of the Corruption of Pallas been retconned to the Darkin Bow, and Varus made a deal with the weapon after his distraught losses during his duties as a guardian of Pallas then a seamless interconnection between the Human Varus & The Darkin Bow could have been achieved. 

I'm disappointed, and heavily infuriated that this was the direction chosen. Foundations & Narrative is much more capable than using this new flavor text basis as a form of new direction, and I feel it's sub-par to the Riot standard.
